caption: Did delivery to a hotel came to the door pizza was good.
The place serves large portions and for affordable pricing. super friendly employees. Highly recommended.

I go to this marvelous  place often since I like the good mood that is unique to this restaurant. The crew is very friendly and skilfull. The service is deeply rapid. Most important, the food they serve is outstanding. I visited many times and I was never disappointed. The pay is honest. I recommend this restaurant to all my friends.
Amazing service!!! Pizza was delicious

I ordered a Italian Cold Cut for delivery.  When I got it it was a dry sandwich with just meat and cheese.  No lettuce, no tomato, NO OIL AND VINEGAR.  These are the things along with the meat that makes it a Italian Cold Cut.  When I called back to inquire about the missing items I was told their sub doesn’t come with that stuff you have to request it.  In my 50 yrs I’ve never had to request them items.  They already come on the Italian Cold Cut.  The gentleman on the phone was very rude, I will not order from them again, I will just get my Italian Cold Cuts from places like Three Brothers that knows how to make a Italian Cold Cut right.  This coming from a Real Italian

I just moved to the area not too long ago, so I am unfamiliar with the restaurant scene. Having ordered from this place twice for delivery, I can confidently say now that they have secured my future business. Food is phenomenal. Love the chicken parm sub, and the pizza is good too.

Pizza and wings good. This is really to warn you to be careful with online ordering.  I made the mistake of not looking carefully at the site and ended up ordering through Eat Street and not the restaurant's site (I THOUGHT the site looked different but it had been a while since my last order). Anyway, I arrived to pick up my order and they had no record of it. They said they have no contract with Eat Street anymore, so it never got sent to the restaurant.  They made my order quickly but of course I had to pay them.  I got a credit from Eat Street on my credit card..PLUS Eat Street charged more for my PICKUP order.  Just make sure you use the Pizza Bolis site...learn from my mistake 😏

My neighbor ordered three pizzas to share. The quality was mediocre. Canned pineapple on the Hawaiian pizza, their “large” is smaller than the large pizzas I’ve seen from other places, and my fiancé commented that one of the BBQ slices smelled like a wet cleaning rag. The toppings didn’t taste that bad, but the crust was the sort of mushy kind I don’t really like.  The kicker? $20 each. If you want mediocre chain pizza, go to Pizza Hut or Dominos for half the price. Or do what I do and support an actual local pizza shop, with larger sizes, much better taste, AND cheaper prices!
Horrible pizza. Poorly made with a lot of oil dripping everywhere.

I adore this spot! They serve splendid food, their menu is nice, The chef in that restaurant is very trained, I like a lot trying all their dishes. The food is always good, the attitude towards the clients  is agreeable. I  go often to this restaurant and I not even once was disappointed. I recommend this place.

I placed my order at 10:51 this morning and received an email that my food would arrive between 11:40-11:50. At 12 PM, I called to check in because the track my order feature said my food was still being prepared and it does not take an hour to make half a sub. I was put on hold for 3 minutes so I hung up and called back. I was then told that my food would take an additional 40 minutes to be delivered because they "opened late". I asked if they could remove the delivery fee if I drive over to pick it up because I did not want to wait another whole hour for a simple sub. I was told that the delivery fee can't be removed without a manager and just ended up cancelling because this was a huge waste of time. You all really need to do better.
The pizza I got from here was to saugy I never order after that. It just didnt taste good at all. It was like wet bread type of taste. The bread was humid because of oil.

I have been extremely disappointed and dissatisfied with both times I’ve ordered from this location. The delivery time is no less than an hour and a half and when they arrive, something is always missing. They don’t offer to go back and get it, they just give an excuse and it’s upsetting because I’m not getting what I paid for.
I am calling right now in greenbelt and no one is picking up, they picked up before but now will not pick up plz note this
Love the pizza base and the cheese ❤️ Shop needs a new look.
Terrible customer service. Gave me attitude over the phone and put me on hold for a long time. It's not even that good. Whoever is working the phone right now needs to be nicer to their customers.
My fave Pizza Bolis spot in PG area
The worst

I have been going to this spot for years and the service was always mediocre and I didn’t expect much from this place because I only get the $22 Greek pizza here. Everything changed on July 22nd that the only person who was making pizzas (found out his name is OZ)in the back almost assaulted me because I was anxious about my pizza that took longer than 30 mins to make and since no one was at the register I walked to the back to see if someone was making pizzas and saw no one. The cashier rushed from the back and held oz back from assaulting me and apologized for the delay in making the pizza.
Great taste, nice people

Bruuuh, one of (if not) the most stressful orders I made via an app. I ordered a small pizza on the slice app. I couldn't find the restaurant originally when I set out to pick it up, so I called to confirm where it was located. I presume the men on duty didn't understand my question because we had a lengthh back and forth of where they were located and my order I placed with Slice app. I finally got fed up enough to say I'd come by at 430 when I leave my office, though I was hungry at the time. When I got there I should them my app and confirmation email. Turns out Slice app didn't send them my order so we were both right lol. (Read: don't use slice app ... even more so, when you're hungry!) I asked/told them they should make me a medium pizza instead of the original small for my pain and suffering lol, and they did. Thanks, Pizza Bolis. Thay made me give yall one more star and made up for the back and forth earlier.

I will NEVER, EVER order from here again.  Not only did the pizza look gross, but it was cold when I got it. The driver even had me come outside because "he couldn't turn his car off." WTH!! I can't even post a picture😡
Fastest and delicious  and cheap to.. Good service....😊☺️
Is everything in this place Halal?

I’ve order from here twice now and the first time we waited over two hours, called the store to be told the driver was on their way, only to have them never show up and refund us our money. The second time I ordered from here I waited over an hour and a half and had to call the store to be told that the driver had already been here, knocked on my door, and called me but couldn’t get an answer. None of those things happened. I also left a delivery note detailing where my front door is...just read the note! This place is a joke, order from anywhere else in college park but steer clear.  I called the store and the guy on the phone was friendly, as was I, but after explaining my situation I was offered no discount, no refund or anything. I was told my food would get there eventually...which it might, but cold and almost two hours late.  Would give 0 out of 5 stars if I could.  PS I’ve seen other people also complain about “being called” and the store blaming the phone carrier. I was able to call the store from my apartment. I had a clear reception and full bars. There’s no issue on my end, it’s the store. Y’all need to tighten up the ship.  Update: Driver arrives and then tells me he knocked on every door! I was in my living room and never heard a knock at the door (that’s 5 feet away from my couch) and he had the audacity to tell me I needed to leave a note to “come around back” next time! He said he should show me my receipt, that it wasn’t on there. ON THE TOP OF THE RECEIPT ON THE BOX IT SAYS “BASMENT”!!!! If I could I’d give this place -1 stars. If I could attach a screenshot of my order with the note I left that reads: “Around back basement apartment” I would. Worst customer experience I’ve had in awhile, and I’ve worked in it for years. Cold food 2 hours late. I tipped the driver 20% on my card, enjoy the tip you truly didn’t earn!
Okayish Pizza but very good staff
Ordered 7 pizzas. Were ready in less than 25 minutes. Super fast.
Everything is good.
Good pizza, quick service. Open late
Pretty Good Carryout Pizza Decent taste.  Priced reasonable.  Fast prep and service
Slow. Even at 2am when not busy! Go elsewhere.
First time & I'll be returning

YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!! BEWARE!! DO NOT ORDER!! THE WORST SERVICE EXPERIENCE EVER!! I ordered from here after midnight because not too many places deliver after midnight and my toddler daughter was sleep so I needed my food delivered. When the driver arrived he told me that he does not deliver to the door after midnight and I need to come down from my apartment and meet him at his car. I told him my situation repeatedly and that no where was that communicated to me before or after I placed my order and now after an hour later when my food arrives you tell me this information. He claimed it was their stores policy and that he was not going to deliver to my door. He then tells me that he is going to call his manager to see if he can deliver to my door. I am standing from my balcony watching him because he has his light on in his car and at no time did he make a call to anybody  he then he calls me back to tell me his manager said he can’t deliver to my door.  I then asked if I could call him back and called his manager and not only did he lie and not ask his manager his manager said that he is supposed to come to your door and will call the driver to see what is going on.  Immediately after hanging up with the manager the driver calls me and asks me in a very rude manner “are you coming down to get your food?”. I tell him that I spoke with your manager and he said he is going to talk to you.  He then hangs up and I call his manager again who says to me “The driver is scared for his safety and does not want to come up”. I proceed to tell him how unprofessional and sad this is. Sidebar:We are talking about Greenbelt/college park area, what Golden safe streets are you waking & living around that you are fearing for your safety in this area?  The manager says to me “ IF YOU CAN ASSURE HIS SAFETY THEN HE WILL COME UPSTAIRS TO YOU”. 2018 nothing suprises me anymore but really, this statement can be broken down in so many ways that all lead to “just wrong”.  The driver then calls me clearly angry as if I am in the wrong here and says “how much money do you have on you, I need to know because I want to have your change ready”. He runs up the stairs quickly grabs he money and hands me the sandwhich and I calmly  tell him that what you all are doing is wrong and I am reporting this. He proceeds to yell as he is waking down the steps, “ y’all don’t tip”.  The sandwhich was cold and soggy because at this point it’s been an addition 20 minutes of this man trying not to deliver my food.  The driver calls me a minute later telling me to come down stairs because no I shorted him a dollar. I tell him that I did not short him a dollar but will drop the money in the morning.  The next morning I check the opening time which claimed to be 10:30am to give them their dollar because part of being a customer is to assure the safety of the delivery person and count the money he receives and deliver the money to him if he doesn’t do his job and snatches money then runs down the steps shouting at someone and realizes he didn’t get all his money. (Yes that was sarcasm)  When I arrived at 11:00am they were not open however they had their sign up that said opened.  The worst experience ever on so many levels and I will be writing corporate and anywhere else I can to make sure nobody experiences the same thing.  And for real Pizza Bolis y’all need to do better and we need to do better as human beings. If you can take my money and deliver to me after 5pm when it is dark then you can deliver to me after midnight. Don’t lie and make up your own delivery rules because it looks like you are discriminating on the community I live in which I love and have safely raised my daughter in the last 2 years. If you have a safety concern with my community then make it public so we know not to order from you. Be courteous and respectful to your clients and don’t treat them like they have no value because of where they live.  God bless and I hope you learn something from all of this.

The service is mediocre.  The pizza is the same. Not the best pizza.  Do not order Garlic bread. It's just a regular French bread with butter and garlic powder on it. The picture on the menu is NOT the same for Garlic Bread. See picture of their Garlic bread.  I didn't try anything else but I highly suggest dont order it.  Also you will have go hunt for your toppings. They are that scattered.
“Jumbo onion rings” were tiny..the inside of my Stromboli was undercooked—had to throw it in my oven. Not pleased..
Slow service cook arrived late fries under cooked
The food is great and all, but the staff need to communicate more efficiently. Not organized with their orders.
The only one that open late night

The staff relationship to customers is terrible it's as if everyone there is terrible. Except like the driver the older gentleman. Simple instructions on preparing food couldn't be followed. I am really looking forward to speaking to their District Manager one of these days with the images of my food quality.

This location is trash. The cooks there dont wash their hands amd the way they prep their food is wrong. They don't rotate what new and whats old. They will sell you chicken wings that have are 2 weeks old. Please dont eat there. Not unless you want to get sick
they steal people credit and debit cards numbers and allow people to order food. Never a manager around to talk,  if you like to have your bank account information hack, order here.
I ordered once and the pizza cost about 12 dollars. I paid with a twenty and got one dollar back.

Ordered mozz sticks, onion rings, and fries. All were soggy, half cooked as if pulled from an oven. Nothing was fried as you would expect from those items. Mozz sticks were pale, and under cooked, flour-y ghostly color. Onion rings sagged when picked up. Fries were unseasoned and cheap. Portions were ridculously small. A large fry, 10 piece onion ring, 6 piece mozz sticks cost $17 and not worth a penny.
Literally the best pizza in college park, and the guys working there are pretty cool too and have always been helpful.
Chicken wings are the best...pizza good too.
Do not order fries. Soggy and burnt.  Pizza was delicious.
Faaaast and delicious !!! Cheap too

So, where to begin...I’ve ordered from Pizza Bolis four times now, and three out of the four have had the same issue. I always order through Grub Hub. The last three times, after waiting for over an hour (20 minutes past the Grub Hub estimated delivery time), I called the restaurant asking for an update and was told “the driver came to your address and called you but no one picked up.” I received no missed calls, no voicemails, nothing. Ive never had an issue with any other restaurant reaching me, though. I explained this to the manager but was told, “you need to talk to your phone carrier, it isn’t our fault.” It wasn’t until this most recent delivery that I figured out the issue...my phone number was put in incorrectly on the Pizza Bolis sticker. Now, I was told by the driver that the manager is responsible for putting the phone numbers in. The last four numbers on the sticker were 8353, my number ends in 8358. I confirmed my number on my Grub Hub profile was correct, so the mistake had to have been with the restaurant. When I explained this to the restaurant, and how this must have been what happened with the last three orders, they offered nothing. I said I believed I should get some sort of compensation because this happened three times, my phone carrier was blamed when it was in fact the restaurants fault, and they forgot my soda, to boot. The manager said, “well we remade the pizza for you on this most recent delivery.” I don’t believe that to be true because the pizza arrived cold. And so when I told the manager that this was unacceptable and that i was going to go and write a detailed one star review on every place possible he said, “go ahead, I don’t care. Do whatever you want,” and hung up on me. Absolutely terrible customer service, marginal pizza, and all around awful experiences. I believe in second chances but I gave Pizza Bolis four chances, and so I am done. I recommend ordering from any place but Pizza Bolis. You can get better quality pizza from Paisanos, and they have better customer service, too. Sorry, Pizza Bolis, but you guys have lost what would have been a repeat customer, and I will be sure to describe the attitude you exhibited to anyone who may want to buy pizza from you.  UPDATE: I changed my original review from 1 star to 4 stars, because Pizza Bolis did refund my order today (three days later, but a refund nonetheless, and so I am grateful). I will give them one more chance, and hopefully there aren’t anymore issues next time.

I can say that they are rude , call twice  was on hold for 30 min call back to order a Stromboli with just pepperoni  it sound like he got upset Because I kept repeating my order because it sounded like he was saying sausage and pepperoni when I kept said no sausage  he kept saying  sausages.  I had stop make him say it  slow ,  he goes and say no I was saying sauce and cheese and I corrected him and said it sound like you said sausage and cheese .My order was cold  so I’m not try them again.  Hope y’all get  customer service together .
Very rude service. Dont ask for anything on the menu that they dont serve because you will get straight disrespect.
This place sucks.
(Translated by Google) Excellent.  (Original) Excelent .
😊😊 all smiles 😊😊
Besr UMD pizza I've been able to find. Mondays are buy one large pizza get one free. The prices are reasonable (except for their barbeque chicken pizzas which are twice as much as everything else).
No Complaints!
Food is priced very reasonably. Staff is quick and courteous. Food quality is good. 15 min wait to 20 on avg for a pizza.
the website in the "menu" section is wrong! it is for another pizza bolis store! I just made a wrong order!
Always get from here and the food is always tasty and fresh.
Super fresh tasty pizza! Open late is a big plus!

I ordered a steak and cheese sub through grub hub, When I opened the sub, the meat was not steak it was ground beef or sausage. And none of the toppings were on the sub that I asked for. I am waiting on my refund, they are closed right now. When I looked at the bag that the sub came in, it had someone elses name on the order receipt. I STRONGLY SUGGEST that you check you food right before the driver leaves your door step! I have ordered from them few times, but this is my last. NEVER AGAIN!

Delivery man held the pizza hostage even after the money was extended to him as if i wasnt going to pay.... Then when i opened the box the pizza didnt have the correct toppings and it was so greasy i couldn't even eat it... 😒😒😒
Consistent and on time

Honestly don't understand the negative feedback- I eat here multiple times a month and everything about the establishment is outstanding. Best prices you'll find in College Park for the amount of food, great tasting ingredients and if you do pick-up, they can have the pizzas ready in no time!  Definitely worth a second try if you've ever somehow had a bad experience!
Not bad pizza for the price. Will go again

I ordered four pizzas at 4:30. It's about 8:00 now and I still don't have them. Whenever I call I get the busy signal and the one time I got through and complained, they hung up on me when I complained how my pizza has been 3 hours late!
